sentences.english: A win is always good for morale.
sentences.chinese: 胜利总是可以鼓舞士气。

sentences.chinese: 政变未遂挫伤了军队的士气。

sentences.chinese: 王子去这个饱受战争磨难的国家鼓舞士气的使命

detailed_translations.english: the level of confidence and positive feelings that people have, especially people who work together, who belong to the same team etc

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

sentences.english: A hospital administrator has resigned over claims he lied to get the job.
sentences.chinese: 一位医院主管因为有人声称他的职位是骗来的而辞职了。

detailed_translations.english: to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization
to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization

sentences.english: The rumor rocked the whole city.
sentences.chinese: 谣言使整个城市惊慌不安。

sentences.english: In fact the rumor is without foundation.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这个谣传没有根据。

name: smoothly
trans: 平滑地, 平稳地, 流畅地, 顺利地

sentences.english: Traffic flowed smoothly.
sentences.chinese: 路上交通畅通。

detailed_translations.english: in a steady way, without stopping and starting again

sentences.english: Sara had the task of preparing the agenda for meetings.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉的任务是准备会议议程。

sentences.english: I was given the task of building a fire.
sentences.chinese: 我分配到生火的任务。

sentences.english: the skills required to carry out these tasks
sentences.chinese: 执行这些任务所需要的技能

sentences.chinese: 他很快就意识到他所承担任务的艰巨性了。

sentences.english: Our first task is to gather information.
sentences.chinese: 我们的首要任务是收集信息。

sentences.english: Monkeys can be taught to do simple tasks .
sentences.chinese: 猴子能被教会做一些简单的事。

sentences.english: They have the unenviable task of supervising the most dangerous prison in the country.
sentences.chinese: 他们有个令人头疼的工作，就是管理国家最危险的监狱。

sentences.english: Volunteers had the thankless task of distributing campaign leaflets.
sentences.chinese: 志愿者的任务是分发活动传单，吃力不讨好。

sentences.english: Trying to bring up a small daughter on your own is no easy task .
sentences.chinese: 独自抚养年幼的女儿不是件轻而易举的事。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that must be done, especially one that is difficult or unpleasant or that must be done regularly

sentences.english: The book will show you what the best CEO should know.
sentences.chinese: 这本书会告诉你最好的执行总裁该了解什么。

sentences.english: You'd think it might be our CEO or the workers, but in fact, the stockholders control the money so they have the most power.

sentences.chinese: 但是我意识到，第二种方式能够改变人们交流的方式，不仅仅是首席执行官，它也会改变我们做生意的方式。

detailed_translations.english: the person with the most authority in a large company

sentences.english: Littman refused to discuss the case publicly.
sentences.chinese: 利特曼拒绝公开讨论此案。

sentences.english: If you would like to discuss the matter further, please call me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想进一步讨论此事，请打电话给我。

sentences.english: This topic will be discussed in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 该主题将在第四章进行详述。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something with another person or a group in order to exchange ideas or decide something

sentences.english: My attention wasn’t really on the game.
sentences.chinese: 我的注意力其实不在比赛上。

sentences.english: She tried to pay attention to what he was saying.
sentences.chinese: 她尽量注意听他说话。

sentences.english: If you paid more attention in class, you might actually learn something!
sentences.chinese: 要是你上课更认真些，也许能实实在在地学到些东西！

sentences.english: Scott sat down at his desk and turned his attention to the file he had in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特在自己的办公桌前坐下，将注意力转向面前的文件。

sentences.english: As a society we need to give more attention to the needs of older people.
sentences.chinese: 生活在同一社会里，我们得更加关注长者的需求。

sentences.english: Now he’s gone, I can give you my undivided attention .
sentences.chinese: 现在他已经走了，我可以把全部注意力都放在你身上。

sentences.english: This game is fun and is sure to keep the attention of any young student.
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏很有趣，一定能使年幼学生保持注意力。

sentences.english: They listened to the speech with close attention .
sentences.chinese: 他们很认真地听演讲。

sentences.english: Attention to detail is essential in this job.
sentences.chinese: 关注细节是这份工作所必需的。

sentences.english: During the lecture Sarah’s attention began to wander .
sentences.chinese: 上课时，萨拉开始走神了。

detailed_translations.english: when you carefully listen to, look at, or think about someone or something

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

name: item
trans: 条, 条款, 项, 项目, 条目

sentences.english: He opened the cardboard box and took out each item.
sentences.chinese: 他打开纸板箱把里面的物品一一拿出来。

sentences.english: The store is having a sale on furniture and household items.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店正在减价出售家具和家居用品。

sentences.english: luxury items such as exotic spices and perfumes
sentences.chinese: 异国香料和香水之类的奢侈品

sentences.english: The original 1965 bottle is now a collector’s item (= one of a set of objects people like to collect because they are interesting or valuable ).
sentences.chinese: 这瓶1965年生产的原装酒现在是收藏品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔尤指清单上、一群或一组事物中的〕一项，一件，一条
detailed_translations.english: a single thing, especially one thing in a list, group, or set of things

name: negotiate
trans: 商议; 谈判; 协商

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: Charlie thinks money will solve all his problems.
sentences.chinese: 查理认为钱能解决他所有的问题。

sentences.english: the best way of solving our dilemma
sentences.chinese: 解决我们两难处境的最佳办法

sentences.english: attempts to solve a mathematical equation
sentences.chinese: 解数学方程式的尝试

detailed_translations.english: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

sentences.english: He never even stopped to congratulate me.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至没有过来向我祝贺。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that you are happy because they have achieved something or because something nice has happened to them

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

sentences.english: The Republicans have stuck to their conservative agenda.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人坚持自己的保守议题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 议程；日常工作事项；日程表
detailed_translations.english: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

sentences.chinese: 我们必须更仔细地安排开支。

sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 低廉的， 收费公道的
detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑

sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

sentences.chinese: 仓库全给烧毁了。

sentences.chinese: 30人死于芝加哥市中心的一场火灾。

sentences.chinese: 警方认为有人故意纵火。

sentences.chinese: 暴徒纵火焚烧了一整排商店。

sentences.english: Soldiers fired on the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 士兵朝人群开枪。

detailed_translations.english: uncontrolled flames, light, and heat that destroy and damage things

sentences.chinese: 他们又往前走了一点。

sentences.english: His hands moved further down her back.
sentences.chinese: 他的手在她背上继续往下滑。

sentences.english: They’ve never been further south than San Diego.
sentences.chinese: 他们从没有到过比圣迭戈更往南的地方。

detailed_translations.english: a greater distance, or beyond a particular place

sentences.english: These programs can be integrated with your existing software.
sentences.chinese: 这些程序能和你的已有的软件整合成一体。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

sentences.chinese: 这份工作包括什么？

sentences.english: I didn’t realize putting on a play involved so much work.
sentences.chinese: 我没想到上演一出戏剧需要做这么多的工作。

detailed_translations.english: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

name: courteous
trans: 彬彬有礼的, 谦恭的

sentences.english: The staff are always courteous and helpful.
sentences.chinese: 员工们总是彬彬有礼、乐于帮助。

sentences.english: a courteous reply
sentences.chinese: 恭敬有礼的回答

detailed_translations.english: polite and showing respect for other people

sentences.english: generational conflict
sentences.chinese: 两代人之间的冲突

sentences.english: generational divisions
sentences.chinese: 两代人之间的分歧

detailed_translations.english: connected with a particular generation or the relationship between different generations

sentences.english: people of the same gender
sentences.chinese: 同性别的人

sentences.english: Discrimination on grounds of race or gender is forbidden.
sentences.chinese: 严禁种族歧视和性别歧视。

sentences.english: There may be gender differences in attitudes to paid work.
sentences.chinese: 对待有偿劳动的态度可能存在着性别差异。

sentences.english: traditional gender roles
sentences.chinese: 传统的性别角色

sentences.english: toys that do not reinforce gender stereotypes
sentences.chinese: 不强化性别模式化观念的玩具

sentences.english: a science fiction story dealing with gender issues
sentences.chinese: 以性别问题为题材的科幻故事

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being male or female

sentences.english: ...equality of the sexes.
sentences.chinese: …性别平等。

detailed_translations.chinese: 等同； 平等； 相等
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people have the same rights, advantages etc

sentences.chinese: 我很同情，但不知道如何帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry for someone because you understand their problems

name: implement
trans: 使(某事物)生效; 履行; 实施; 贯彻

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

sentences.english: challenges to the existing power structure
sentences.chinese: 对现有权力结构的挑战

sentences.english: A new management structure has been introduced.
sentences.chinese: 已推行一种新的管理结构。

sentences.english: molecular structures
sentences.chinese: 分子结构

detailed_translations.english: the way in which the parts of something are connected with each other and form a whole, or the thing that these parts make up

name: process
trans: 过程, 程序, 步骤, 工序

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

sentences.english: an alarm system
sentences.chinese: 警报系统

sentences.english: a well-designed heating system
sentences.chinese: 设计良好的供暖系统

sentences.english: the digestive system
sentences.chinese: 消化系统

sentences.english: the railway system
sentences.chinese: 铁路系统

detailed_translations.chinese: 系统； 制度， 体制； 方法， 做法； 身体
detailed_translations.english: a group of related parts that work together as a whole for a particular purpose

name: mission
trans: 艰巨的任务,艰辛的历程

sentences.english: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow
sentences.chinese: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

name: statement
trans: 陈述, 声明, 说法

sentences.english: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
sentences.chinese: 在一份官方声明中，她正式宣布辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
detailed_translations.english: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

name: revise
trans: 修订, 修改, 修正, 校订

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

sentences.english: proposals to radically restructure Britain’s electronics industry
sentences.chinese: 彻底整顿英国电子行业的提议

detailed_translations.english: to change the way in which something such as a government, business, or system is organized

name: revamp
trans: 将(某物)更新(尤指外观); 翻新

sentences.english: Many older companies are revamping their image.
sentences.chinese: 很多老牌公司都在更新公司形象。

sentences.english: The revamp includes replacing the old navy uniform with a crisp blue and white cotton outfit.
sentences.chinese: 改进的内容包括将旧海军制服换成清新的蓝白相间的棉套装。

detailed_translations.english: to change something in order to improve it and make it seem more modern
Revamp is also a noun

name: transform
trans: 转换, 改造, 改变, 改变, 变换, 转化

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

sentences.english: I find it hard to cope with change.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得很难适应变化。

sentences.english: scientists worried about climatic change
sentences.chinese: 为气候变化感到担忧的科学家们

sentences.english: A change in personality may mean your teenager has a drug problem.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子如果性格上发生了变化，可能意味着有吸毒问题。

sentences.english: No major changes were made to the book.
sentences.chinese: 这本书没有大的修改。

sentences.english: She had a change of heart (= change in attitude ) and decided to stay.
sentences.chinese: 她改变主意，决定留下来。

sentences.english: Family life has undergone dramatic change in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来家庭生活发生了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: Matt emptied the loose change from his pockets.
sentences.chinese: 马特把口袋里所有的零钱都掏了出来。

detailed_translations.english: the process or result of something or someone becoming different

sentences.english: the storage of highly radioactive material
sentences.chinese: 高放射性材料的存放

sentences.english: storage costs
sentences.chinese: 保管费用

detailed_translations.english: the process of keeping or putting something in a special place while it is not being used

sentences.english: No Parking (= used on signs )
sentences.chinese: 禁止停车

sentences.english: a £45 parking fine
sentences.chinese: 45英镑的违章停车罚款

detailed_translations.english: the act of parking a car or other vehicle

sentences.english: I do yoga twice a week.
sentences.chinese: 我一周做两次瑜伽。

detailed_translations.chinese: 瑜珈（意为“结合”，指修行）；瑜珈术
detailed_translations.english: a system of exercises that help you control your mind and body in order to relax

sentences.english: His only recreations are drinking beer and watching football.
sentences.chinese: 他唯一的消遣就是喝啤酒和看足球比赛。

sentences.english: the provision of recreation facilities
sentences.chinese: 提供娱乐设施

detailed_translations.english: an activity that you do for pleasure or amusement

name: space
trans: 空地, 空地方, 空处

sentences.english: How much space is there on each disk?
sentences.chinese: 每张磁盘有多大容量？

sentences.english: The hedge takes up too much space .
sentences.chinese: 这树篱占了太多的地方。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of an area, room, container etc that is empty or available to be used

sentences.english: The staff were very good.
sentences.chinese: 员工们都很棒。

sentences.english: 10 staff were allocated to the task.
sentences.chinese: 10名员工被分派做这项任务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全体职员，员工；工作人员；参谋
detailed_translations.english: the people who work for an organization

sentences.english: ...a period of political uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: …一段政治不稳定时期。

detailed_translations.english: Uncertainty is a state of doubt about the future or about what is the right thing to do

sentences.english: As soon as they found out I was a doctor, their whole attitude changed.
sentences.chinese: 他们一听说我是医生，态度就完全改变了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 态度， 看法； 姿势
detailed_translations.english: the opinions and feelings that you usually have about something, especially when this is shown in your behaviour

name: resistant
trans: 抵抗的; 对抗的; 抗拒的; 有阻力的

sentences.english: Some people are very resistant to the idea of exercise.
sentences.chinese: 一些人对锻炼的主意非常抵制。

detailed_translations.english: not damaged or affected by something

name: positive
trans: 积极的, 有助益的, 建设性的

sentences.english: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 至少这个情况也产生了一些积极的东西。

sentences.english: Write down all the positive things about your life.
sentences.chinese: 记下生活中所有好的事情。

sentences.english: The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境对孩子们的健康有好处。

sentences.english: It’s been a very positive experience for her.
sentences.chinese: 那对她来说是一次非常有益的经历。

sentences.english: TV can be a positive influence .
sentences.chinese: 电视也会有好的影响。

sentences.english: the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人为社区做出的积极贡献

sentences.english: It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side , I feel physically fine.
sentences.chinese: 日子过得不容易，不过从好的方面看，我的身体状况还不错。

sentences.english: Women should be portrayed in a more positive light .
sentences.chinese: 应该从更正面的角度来描绘女性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的， 明确的； 积极的， 肯定的
detailed_translations.english: good or useful

name: traditional
trans: 传统的, 因袭的, 惯例的

sentences.english: traditional Italian cooking
sentences.chinese: 传统的意大利烹饪

sentences.english: a traditional Irish folk song
sentences.chinese: 传统的爱尔兰民歌

sentences.english: a traditional method of brewing beer
sentences.chinese: 传统的啤酒酿造方法

detailed_translations.english: being part of the traditions of a country or group of people

name: benefit
trans: 利益, 好处, 有利的影响

sentences.english: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

detailed_translations.english: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: 利益，恩惠；救济金，保险金，津贴
detailed_translations.english: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money

sentences.english: Can I borrow your pen for a minute?
sentences.chinese: 我可以借你的笔用一下吗？

sentences.english: They borrowed heavily (=  borrowed a lot of money  ) from the bank to start their new business.
sentences.chinese: 他们向银行贷了巨款来创办新公司。

detailed_translations.english: to use something that belongs to someone else and that you must give back to them later

sentences.english: He had enough money to pay off his outstanding debts.
sentences.chinese: 他有足够的钱偿还亏欠的债务。

sentences.english: students who run up huge debts
sentences.chinese: 欠下巨额债务的学生

detailed_translations.english: a sum of money that a person or organization owes

sentences.english: Children will soon make deductions about the meaning of a word.
sentences.chinese: 儿童不久就能推断词义了。

detailed_translations.english: the process of using the knowledge or information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion, or the opinion that you form

sentences.english: low-income families
sentences.chinese: 低收入家庭

detailed_translations.english: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

sentences.english: Jill gradually became aware of an awful smell.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔渐渐地闻到了一股难闻的气味。

sentences.english: Gradually, my ankle got better.
sentences.chinese: 我的脚踝慢慢好了。

detailed_translations.english: slowly, over a long period of time

sentences.english: How much do I owe you (= often used to show that you want to pay for something )?
sentences.chinese: 我该付你多少钱？

sentences.english: He owes his success to hard work.
sentences.chinese: 他的成功是靠勤奋工作。

detailed_translations.english: to need to pay someone for something that they have done for you or sold to you, or to need to give someone back money that they have lent you

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

sentences.english: He borrowed £150,000 and used the money for legal expenses.
sentences.chinese: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.english: Conference rooms were equipped at great expense.
sentences.chinese: 装备会议室花费巨大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花费， 消费， 费用； 开支， 业务费用
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you spend on something

sentences.english: Buying a house had taken all their savings.
sentences.chinese: 买房子花掉了他们所有的积蓄。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节省， 节约； 储蓄金， 存款
detailed_translations.english: all the money that you have saved, especially in a bank

sentences.english: We obtained a loan from the government.
sentences.chinese: 我们得了一笔政府贷款。

sentences.english: If you ask him for a loan, he'll come through.
sentences.chinese: 如果你向他贷款，他会满足你的要求的。

sentences.english: The company won't keep going unless we can get some loan.
sentences.chinese: 除非我们能搞到贷款，否则公司就维持不下去了。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you borrow from a bank etc

sentences.english: The average American has not even thought about next year’s election.
sentences.chinese: 普通的美国人甚至还没有想过明年的选举。

sentences.english: In an average week I drive about 250 miles.
sentences.chinese: 平常我每周开车约250英里。

detailed_translations.english: having qualities that are typical of most people or things

sentences.english: Have you paid the phone bill?
sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

name: reasonably
trans: 适度地, 尚可, 过得去

sentences.english: He can’t reasonably be expected to have known that.
sentences.chinese: 按理说，他是不可能知道那件事的。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is right or fair

sentences.english: Your button has dropped off.
sentences.chinese: 你的纽扣掉了。

sentences.english: The number of deaths on the roads has dropped sharply.
sentences.chinese: 交通事故死亡人数已大大减少。

detailed_translations.english: to fall suddenly onto the ground or into something

sentences.english: For a while, she ran a restaurant in Boston.
sentences.chinese: 有一段时间她在波士顿开餐馆。

sentences.english: Many people don’t care who runs the country.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不在乎由谁统治国家。

sentences.english: Courses are currently being run in London and Edinburgh.
sentences.chinese: 目前伦敦和爱丁堡两地都开设了这些课程。

sentences.english: Many people belong to a pension scheme run by their employers.
sentences.chinese: 许多人参加了由雇主管理的养老金计划。

sentences.english: a state-run (= controlled by the government ) television station
sentences.chinese: 国营电视台

detailed_translations.english: to organize or be in charge of an activity, business, organization, or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 奔跑；赛跑；趋向；奔跑的路程
detailed_translations.english: to be very busy and continuously rushing about

sentences.english: Generally speaking, the more expensive the stereo, the better it is.
sentences.chinese: 一般说来，立体声音响越贵的越好。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that is true in most cases but not always

name: significantly
trans: 意味深长地, 意义深远地, 重要地, 较大地

sentences.english: The Democrats, significantly, finished well behind the Green Party.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是，民主党的得票数远远落后于绿党。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意味深长地，值得注目地
detailed_translations.english: used to say that something is very important

sentences.english: health problems caused by bad housing
sentences.chinese: 住房条件差引起的健康问题

sentences.english: a scheme to provide affordable housing for local people
sentences.chinese: 为当地民众提供平价住宅的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 房屋， 住宅； 住房建筑， 住房供给； 外壳， 外罩
detailed_translations.english: the houses or conditions that people live in

name: option
trans: 选择, 选择权, 选择自由

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

name: alternative
trans: 可供选择的事物, 替换物, 替代品

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

sentences.english: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

detailed_translations.english: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

sentences.english: drastic cuts in government spending
sentences.chinese: 政府开支的急剧削减

sentences.english: Drastic changesare needed if environmental catastrophe is to be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 要想避免环境灾难就需要重大的变革。

detailed_translations.english: extreme and sudden

name: priority
trans: 优先权, 优先, 优先顺序

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

sentences.english: It didn’t move, so she pushed harder.
sentences.chinese: 它一动不动，因此她加力去推。

sentences.english: I promised to push him on the swings for as long as he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 我答应他想在秋千上荡多久我就推多久。

sentences.english: shoppers pushing their grocery carts
sentences.chinese: 推着购物车的购物者

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc
to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc

sentences.english: People who are wrongly arrested may be paid compensation .
sentences.chinese: 被误抓的人有可能得到补偿费。

detailed_translations.english: money paid to someone because they have suffered injury or loss, or because something they own has been damaged

name: contribute
trans: 贡献, 捐献, 捐助

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

sentences.english: There’s a package here for a Miami Lakes address.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一个寄往迈阿密湖的包裹。

detailed_translations.english: something wrapped in paper, packed in a box, and then sent by mail or delivered
to put food or other goods into a bag, box etc ready to be sold or sent

sentences.english: Does the price include postage?
sentences.chinese: 这个价格包含邮费吗？

sentences.english: His job includes looking after under-21 teams.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责包括照管21岁以下球队。

sentences.english: The curriculum includes courses in computing.
sentences.chinese: 课程内容包括计算机技术。

detailed_translations.english: if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first

sentences.english: a subsidiary hypothesis
sentences.chinese: 一个附带假设

detailed_translations.english: connected with, but less important than, something else
a company that is owned or controlled by another larger company

sentences.english: She suffered temporary loss of vision after being struck on the head.
sentences.chinese: 她头部受撞击以后出现暂时性失明。

sentences.english: Tears blurred her vision (= made it difficult for her to see ).
sentences.chinese: 泪水模糊了她的视线。

sentences.english: The idea came to her in a vision.
sentences.chinese: 她在神示中想到了这个主意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to see

sentences.english: The files need updating.
sentences.chinese: 这些档案需要更新。

detailed_translations.english: to add the most recent information to something
the most recent news or information about something

sentences.english: The company plans to merge its subsidiaries in the US.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划合并其在美国的几家子公司。

detailed_translations.english: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

sentences.english: The best way to explore the island is to hire a car.
sentences.chinese: 在该岛寻幽访胜的最好方式就是租用一辆汽车。

sentences.english: What does it cost to hire a boat for a week?
sentences.chinese: 一艘小船租用一星期的费用是多少？

sentences.english: a car hire company
sentences.chinese: 汽车租赁公司

detailed_translations.english: to pay money to borrow something for a short period of time
an arrangement in which you pay a sum of money to borrow something for a short time

sentences.english: I usually buy all my vegetables at the market.
sentences.chinese: 我通常都是在菜市场里购买蔬菜。

sentences.english: Our main overseas market is Japan.
sentences.chinese: 我们的主要海外市场是日本。

detailed_translations.english: a time when people buy and sell goods, food etc, or the place, usually outside or in a large building, where this happens

sentences.english: Children under 14 should be accompanied by a parent.
sentences.chinese: 14 岁以下儿童须由一位家长陪同。

sentences.english: The eggs are guarded by both parents.
sentences.chinese: 那些蛋由两只亲鸟共同守护着。

sentences.english: Melissa’s spending the weekend at her parents’ house.
sentences.chinese: 梅利莎正在父母家度周末。

detailed_translations.english: the father or mother of a person or animal

name: controller
trans: (尤指大型机构或部门的)控制者,管理者,指挥者

sentences.english: ...the job of controller of BBC1.
sentences.chinese: …BBC1的主管一职。

detailed_translations.english: A controller is a person who has responsibility for a particular organization or for a particular part of an organization

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

sentences.english: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.chinese: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.english: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.chinese: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.english: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.chinese: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.english: an increase in spending
sentences.chinese: 开支的增长

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth

name: news
trans: 新闻, 消息, 报导

sentences.english: a late evening news broadcast
sentences.chinese: 晚间新闻节目

sentences.english: I hope to have some good news for you soon.
sentences.chinese: 我希望很快就能给你好消息。

detailed_translations.english: reports of recent events in the newspapers or on the radio or television

sentences.english: She was holding a large box.
sentences.chinese: 她提着一只大箱子。

sentences.english: I held the mouse by its tail.
sentences.chinese: 我抓着耗子的尾巴倒提起来。

sentences.english: Employees hold 30% of the shares.
sentences.chinese: 雇员持有30%的股份。

detailed_translations.english: to carry sth; to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.

sentences.english: He knew he could be free in as little as three years.
sentences.chinese: 他知道只要再过三年他就能自由了。

sentences.english: With one leap he was free!
sentences.chinese: 这一跳他就自由了！

sentences.english: He walked out of the courtroom a free man .
sentences.chinese: 他从法庭走出来，成了自由人。

sentences.english: They have called on the government to set all political prisoners free .
sentences.chinese: 他们呼吁政府释放所有政治犯。

sentences.english: He was found not guilty and walked free from the court.
sentences.chinese: 他被判无罪，当庭释放。

sentences.english: The animals are allowed to run free in the park.
sentences.chinese: 那些动物可以在公园里自由奔跑。

sentences.english: I’m free next weekend.
sentences.chinese: 下个周末我有空。

detailed_translations.english: not held, tied up, or kept somewhere as a prisoner

sentences.english: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，这种病的患者人数明显下降。

sentences.english: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
sentences.chinese: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

sentences.english: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
sentences.chinese: 气温在持续下降。

detailed_translations.english: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less

sentences.english: The tree was about to fall.
sentences.chinese: 那棵树快要倒下了。

sentences.english: The book fell from his hands.
sentences.chinese: 书从他手上跌落。

sentences.english: Enough rain had fallen to flood the grounds.
sentences.chinese: 雨量很大，淹没了地面。

sentences.english: She flushed and her eyes fell (= she looked down ) .
sentences.chinese: 她脸一红，垂下了眼帘。

detailed_translations.english: to move or drop down from a higher position to a lower position

name: remain
trans: 剩下, 余留, 留下

sentences.english: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 难民获准留在英国。

sentences.english: They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in the same place without moving away

detailed_translations.chinese: 残余； 残骸； 遗迹
detailed_translations.english: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

sentences.english: a video of baby’s first steps
sentences.chinese: 一盒婴儿学步的录像带

sentences.english: He took one step and fell.
sentences.chinese: 他走了一步就跌倒了。

sentences.english: I had to retrace my steps (= go back the way I came ) several times before I found the shop.
sentences.chinese: 我来回走了几次才找到那家商店。

sentences.english: This is the first step in reforming the welfare system.
sentences.chinese: 这是福利制度改革的第一步。

sentences.english: Jenny sat on the step in front of the house, waiting.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮坐在房前的台阶上等着。

sentences.english: I accidentally stepped in a puddle.
sentences.chinese: 我不小心踩进了水坑。

detailed_translations.english: the movement you make when you put one foot in front of or behind the other when walking
to bring your foot down on something

sentences.english: Yes, I’ll be there. Thanks for reminding me.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我会去那里的。 谢谢提醒。

sentences.english: He made a few notes to remind himself of what he wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 他记了几条，提醒自己要说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone remember something that they must do

sentences.english: a research proposal outline
sentences.chinese: 研究计划梗概

detailed_translations.english: the main ideas or facts about something, without the details
to describe something in a general way, giving the main points but not the details

name: summary
trans: 概括, 概要, 摘要

sentences.english: A brief summary is given on a separate sheet.
sentences.chinese: 摘要另写一页。

sentences.english: It says torture and summary execution are common.
sentences.chinese: 据说酷刑和草草处决很常见。

detailed_translations.english: a short statement that gives the main information about something, without giving all the details
a summary report, statement etc gives the main facts in a report etc without any of the details or explanations

sentences.english: The party's share of the vote fell by ten percentage points.
sentences.chinese: 该党的得票率下跌了十个百分点。

sentences.english: Here are the main points of the news.
sentences.chinese: 以下是新闻摘要。

sentences.english: There are three important points we must bear in mind.
sentences.chinese: 有三个要点我们必须记住。

sentences.english: He is three points behind the leader.
sentences.chinese: 他落后领先者三分。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or unit on a scale of measurement

sentences.english: The main reason for living in Spain is the weather.
sentences.chinese: 居住在西班牙的主要原因是天气。

sentences.english: What do you consider to be the main problem?
sentences.chinese: 你认为最主要的问题是什么？

sentences.english: Our main concern is that the children are safe.
sentences.chinese: 我们最关心的是保证孩子们的安全。

sentences.english: a summary of the main points of the agreement
sentences.chinese: 协议要点的总结

sentences.english: the main aim of the meeting
sentences.chinese: 会议的要旨

sentences.english: I’ll meet you outside the main entrance.
sentences.chinese: 我在大门外等你。

sentences.english: the main bedroom
sentences.chinese: 主卧室

detailed_translations.english: larger or more important than all other things, ideas etc of the same kind

sentences.english: This is a cheap and simple process. However, there are dangers.
sentences.chinese: 这是个花钱少而又简单的方法，不过有危险。

sentences.english: an extremely unpleasant disease that is, however, easy to treat
sentences.chinese: 一种让人极其难受却容易治疗的病

sentences.english: However you look at it, it's going to cost a lot.
sentences.chinese: 不管你怎么看，它都要花很多钱。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are adding a fact or piece of information that seems surprising, or seems very different from what you have just said

sentences.english: the acquisition of language
sentences.chinese: 语言的习得

detailed_translations.english: the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill

sentences.english: These are the report’s main conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是这篇报告的主要结论。

sentences.english: It is still too early to reach a conclusion on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上作出结论还为时过早。

sentences.english: There are perhaps two main conclusions to be drawn from the above discussion.
sentences.chinese: 从以上的讨论也许可以得出两个主要的结论。

sentences.english: All the evidence pointed to the conclusion that he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 所有证据都表明他是有罪的。

sentences.english: It’s important not to jump to conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 决不要贸然下结论。

sentences.english: The police came to the inescapable conclusion that the children had been murdered.
sentences.chinese: 警方得出了无法回避的结论: 这些儿童被谋杀了。

sentences.english: At the conclusion of the meeting, little progress had been made.
sentences.chinese: 会议开到最后，没有取得多少进展。

detailed_translations.english: something you decide after considering all the information you have

sentences.english: the continents of Asia and Africa
sentences.chinese: 亚洲及非洲大陆

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of land surrounded by sea
able to control your sexual desires

sentences.english: the headquarters of the United Nations
sentences.chinese: 联合国总部

sentences.english: Headquarters in Dublin has/have agreed.
sentences.chinese: 都柏林总部已经同意了

detailed_translations.english: the main building or offices used by a large company or organization

sentences.english: Steve was in a particularly bad mood when he got back.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫回来时情绪特别不好。

sentences.english: The restaurant is particularly popular with young people.
sentences.chinese: 那家餐厅尤其受到年轻人的欢迎。

sentences.english: We are hoping to expand our business, particularly in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望扩大业务，尤其是在欧洲。

sentences.english: British farmers, particularly those producing lamb, are very worried.
sentences.chinese: 英国农场主，尤其是养羊羔的农场主，非常担忧。

detailed_translations.english: more than usual or more than others

name: steady
trans: 稳固的, 稳定的, 平稳的, 持续的

sentences.english: It takes a steady hand to perform surgery.
sentences.chinese: 做手术手要稳。

sentences.english: The plane steadied, and the passengers relaxed
sentences.chinese: 飞机平稳后，乘客们松了一口气。

detailed_translations.english: firmly held in a particular position and not moving or shaking
to hold someone or something so they become more balanced or controlled, or to become more balanced or controlled

name: setback
trans: 顿挫, 挫折, 退步, 逆流

sentences.english: The team’s hopes of playing in Europe suffered a setback last night.
sentences.chinese: 球队赴欧洲参加比赛的希望昨晚遇到了阻碍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挫折， 倒退， 失败
detailed_translations.english: a problem that delays or prevents progress, or makes things worse than they were

sentences.english: a moral dilemma
sentences.chinese: 道德上进退两难的窘境

sentences.english: This placed Robert Kennedy in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。

sentences.english: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问
detailed_translations.english: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

sentences.english: the country’s economic predicament
sentences.chinese: 该国的经济困境

sentences.english: She went to the office to explain her predicament .
sentences.chinese: 她到办事处去说明她的难处。

detailed_translations.english: a difficult or unpleasant situation in which you do not know what to do, or in which you have to make a difficult choice

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

sentences.english: It’s our job to establish the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

sentences.english: There is no cause for alarm.
sentences.chinese: 不必惊慌。

sentences.english: My father fought for the Nationalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲为民族党的事业而奋斗。

detailed_translations.english: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

sentences.english: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

detailed_translations.english: if something results from something else, it is caused by it
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

sentences.english: the long-term effects of the drug
sentences.chinese: 这种毒品的长期影响

sentences.english: I could feel the effects of the thin mountain air.
sentences.chinese: 我能感觉到山上稀薄空气产生的影响。

sentences.english: This ingredient also has the effect of making your skin look younger.
sentences.chinese: 这种成分还有使皮肤看上去更年轻的效果。

sentences.english: A system failure has a knock-on effect throughout the whole hotel.
sentences.chinese: 系统故障会给整个酒店带来连锁反应。

sentences.english: the cumulative effect of human activities on the global environment
sentences.chinese: 人类活动对全球环境日积月累的影响

sentences.english: A much lower dose of the painkiller can still produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 大量减少该止痛药的服用剂量依然能产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: In mental illness, there is a complex relationship between cause and effect.
sentences.chinese: 精神疾病有复杂的因果关系。

detailed_translations.english: a change that is caused by an event, action etc

sentences.english: the areas affected by the hurricane
sentences.chinese: 受飓风影响的地区

sentences.english: a disease that affects the central nervous system
sentences.chinese: 影响中枢神经系统的疾病

sentences.english: decisions which affect our lives
sentences.chinese: 影响我们生活的决定

sentences.english: Trading has been adversely affected by the downturn in consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 贸易受到消费支出回落的不利影响。

sentences.english: We were all deeply affected by her death.
sentences.chinese: 我们都为她的去世深感悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that produces an effect or change in something or in someone’s situation

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

sentences.english: The best solution would be for them to separate.
sentences.chinese: 最好的解决方法是他们分开。

sentences.english: he solution of glucose in water
sentences.chinese: 葡萄糖在水中的溶解

detailed_translations.english: a way of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

name: analysis
trans: 分析, 分析报告, 分析结果

sentences.english: She’s been in analysis for three years.
sentences.chinese: 她接受精神分析治疗已经三年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分析， 分析报告； 分解， 解析
detailed_translations.english: a process in which a doctor makes someone talk about their past experiences, relationships etc in order to help them with mental or emotional problems

sentences.english: Three plus six equals nine (3+6=9).
sentences.chinese: 3 加6等于9。

sentences.english: The total cost was $10,000, plus 14% interest.
sentences.chinese: 全部费用是1万美元，外加14%的利息。

sentences.english: Daytime temperatures barely reached plus 5˚.
sentences.chinese: 白天的气温仅零上5度。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that one number or amount is added to another
more than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures

sentences.english: Digital cell phones offer more security, but the downside is that they have less power.
sentences.chinese: 数字手机安全性更好，但其劣势在于电力不足。

detailed_translations.chinese: 负面，缺点；下降趋势；底侧

sentences.english: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

detailed_translations.english: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: 利益，恩惠；救济金，保险金，津贴
detailed_translations.english: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money

sentences.english: The payment will be refunded to you minus a small service charge.
sentences.chinese: 这笔款项扣除一小笔服务费后将退还给你。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that one number or quantity is being  subtract ed  from another
something that is a disadvantage because it makes a situation unpleasant
used to talk about a disadvantage of a thing or situation

sentences.english: The upside of the whole thing is that we got a free trip to Jamaica.
sentences.chinese: 整个事情的好处是我们得到一次免费去牙买加的机会。

sentences.english: Younger workers tend to be at an advantage (=  have an advantage  ) when applying for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 年轻点的工人申请工作时往往处于优势地位。

sentences.english: One of the many advantages of living in New York is that you can eat out at almost any time of day.
sentences.chinese: 住在纽约的诸多好处之一是几乎任何时候都可以外出吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps you to be more successful than others, or the state of having this

sentences.english: It’s a great city – the only drawback is the weather.
sentences.chinese: 这是座很不错的城市，唯一的不足就是天气。

detailed_translations.english: a disadvantage of a situation, plan, product etc

name: unacceptable
trans: 难以接受的, 不受欢迎的

sentences.english: I found her attitude totally unacceptable.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得她的态度让人完全不能接受。

sentences.english: unacceptable levels of pollution
sentences.chinese: 无法容忍的污染程度

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能接受的；不受欢迎的
detailed_translations.english: something that is unacceptable is so wrong or bad that you think it should not be allowed

name: miss
trans: 未出席, 错过, 未赶上

sentences.english: I’d like to make an appointment with Miss Taylor.
sentences.chinese: 我想约一下泰勒小姐。

detailed_translations.english: used in front of the family name of a woman who is not married to address her politely, to write to her, or to talk about her

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

sentences.english: The police force is below strength at the moment (= there are fewer police than there should be ).
sentences.chinese: 目前警力不足。

sentences.english: the strength of a rope
sentences.chinese: 绳子的强度

detailed_translations.english: the number of people in a team, army etc

name: weakness
trans: 虚弱, 弱点, 薄弱, 软弱

sentences.english: The legislation has a fundamental weakness.
sentences.chinese: 这项立法有一个根本性缺陷。

sentences.english: The plan has strengths and weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划既有优点又有缺点。

sentences.english: muscular weakness
sentences.chinese: 肌无力

sentences.english: weakness in the economy
sentences.chinese: 经济疲软

detailed_translations.english: a fault in someone’s character or in a system, organization, design etc

sentences.english: Your threats don’t scare me.
sentences.chinese: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

sentences.english: threats made against his wife and children
sentences.chinese: 对他妻儿的威胁

sentences.english: Nichols never carried out his threat to resign.
sentences.chinese: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职，但从未付诸行动。

sentences.english: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
sentences.chinese: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。

sentences.english: She dismissed the statement as an empty threat .
sentences.chinese: 她无视这项声明，认为是个空口威胁。

sentences.english: They warned him with veiled threats not to mention anything he had witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。

sentences.english: The police are investigating death threats made against the two men.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。

sentences.english: Officials at the school say they received a bomb threat at approximately 11:30 a.m. today.
sentences.chinese: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

sentences.english: There are fewer opportunities for new graduates this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年新毕业的大学生就业机会较少。

detailed_translations.english: a chance to do something or an occasion when it is easy for you to do something

sentences.english: My family were very supportive throughout the divorce.
sentences.chinese: 离婚过程中我的家人自始至终都很支持我。

detailed_translations.english: giving help or encouragement, especially to someone who is in a difficult situation – used to show approval

sentences.english: She got great satisfaction from helping people to learn.
sentences.chinese: 她在帮助人们学习的过程中得到很大的满足。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of happiness or pleasure because you have achieved something or got what you wanted

name: wonder
trans: 惊讶, 怀疑, 惊奇, 想知道

sentences.english: What are they going to do now, I wonder ?
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，他们现在打算怎么办呢？

sentences.english: He’s been leaving work early a lot – it makes you wonder , doesn’t it?
sentences.chinese: 他最近经常提早下班——让人觉得奇怪，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you are not sure about and try to guess what is true, what will happen etc

sentences.english: Do you ever wonder if you made the right decision?
sentences.chinese: 你怀疑过自己所作的决定是否正确吗？

sentences.english: The judges’ decision is final (= it will not be changed ).
sentences.chinese: 法官的裁决是最终判决。

sentences.english: the ability to act with speed and decision
sentences.chinese: 处事迅速果断的能力

detailed_translations.english: a choice or judgment that you make after a period of discussion or thought

sentences.english: There was a ladder propped up against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 有一把梯子靠在墙边。

sentences.english: sailing against the wind
sentences.chinese: 逆风航行

detailed_translations.english: next to and touching an upright surface, especially for support

sentences.english: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。

sentences.english: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。

sentences.english: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:她一直未能实现赢取奥运会金牌的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: survey
trans: 问卷, 测量, 调查, 纵览, 视察

sentences.english: Of the 100 companies surveyed, 10% had a turnover of £50 m to £99 m.
sentences.chinese: 被调查的 100 家公司中，10% 的公司营业额在 5,000 万到 9,900 万英镑之间。

sentences.english: She turned to survey her daughter’s pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她转过头审视女儿苍白的面容。

sentences.english: We conducted a survey of parents in the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这个村子的孩子父母作了一次调查。

sentences.english: a geological survey
sentences.chinese: 地质勘察

detailed_translations.english: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions
a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

name: proactive
trans: 积极主动的, 主动出击的, 先发制人的

sentences.english: a proactive approach to staffing requirements
sentences.chinese: 对人事需求的积极处理方法

detailed_translations.chinese: 积极主动的； 先发制人的
detailed_translations.english: making things happen or change rather than reacting to events

sentences.english: She has just landed the lead role in their latest production.
sentences.chinese: 她刚在他们最新的作品中取得了主角。

detailed_translations.english: the character played by an actor in a play or film

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

sentences.english: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.chinese: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

detailed_translations.english: happening once a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 年报， 年鉴； 一年生的植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that lives for one year or season

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: lead
trans: 指挥, 领导, 率领

sentences.english: drinking water supplied by old-fashioned lead pipes
sentences.chinese: 由老式铅管输送的饮用水

detailed_translations.english: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

sentences.english: child development
sentences.chinese: 儿童发育

sentences.english: The funds will be used for marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 这笔资金将用于市场营销和产品开发。

detailed_translations.english: the process of gradually becoming bigger, better, stronger, or more advanced

sentences.english: Kids were playing and chasing each other.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在互相追逐嬉闹。

sentences.english: He’s learning to play the piano.
sentences.chinese: 他在学习弹钢琴。

detailed_translations.english: when children play, they do things that they enjoy, often with other people or with toys

sentences.english: The plot was so involved that very few people knew what was going on.
sentences.chinese: 情节太复杂，几乎没人知道是怎么回事。

detailed_translations.english: having so many different parts that it is difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及；使参与；包含（involve的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: The weather became warmer.
sentences.chinese: 天气变暖和了。

sentences.english: Slowly my eyes became accustomed to the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛渐渐适应了黑暗。

sentences.english: Helen became increasingly anxious about her husband’s strange behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 海伦越来越担心她丈夫的反常行为。

sentences.english: Pollution from cars has become a major problem.
sentences.chinese: 汽车污染已成为严重的问题。

sentences.english: When did you first want to become a teacher?
sentences.chinese: 你最早是什么时候想要当一名教师的？

detailed_translations.english: to start to have a feeling or quality, or to start to develop into something

name: responsibility
trans: 责任, 负担, 职责

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

sentences.english: games suitable for specific age groups
sentences.chinese: 适合特定年龄组的游戏

sentences.english: a specific example of alcohol’s effect on the body
sentences.chinese: 酒精对身体影响的具体例子

detailed_translations.english: a specific thing, person, or group is one particular thing, person, or group
particular details

name: realistic
trans: 现实的, 实际可行的

sentences.english: It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
sentences.chinese: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

detailed_translations.english: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

sentences.english: It is unrealistic to believe perfection is an attainable goal.
sentences.chinese: 相信可以达到完美是不现实的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可获得的， 可达到的， 可实现的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is attainable can be achieved

sentences.english: We need to be consistent in our approach.
sentences.chinese: 我们在方法上要前后一致。

detailed_translations.english: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards etc – usually used to show approval

sentences.english: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

detailed_translations.english: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

sentences.english: Oddly enough, that is precisely what I intend.
sentences.chinese: 说也奇怪， 那正是我的打算。

sentences.english: They intend to be an army of light against the onslaught of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算成为一支光明之师对抗黑暗军团的猛烈进攻。

sentences.english: Frances achieved very good exam results.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西丝考试取得了优异成绩。

sentences.english: Wilson has achieved considerable success as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊作为一名艺术家成就斐然。

sentences.english: She eventually achieved her goal of becoming a professor.
sentences.chinese: 她终于实现目标，当上了教授。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully complete something or get a good result, especially by working hard

sentences.english: a teaching career
sentences.chinese: 教学事业

sentences.english: He realized that his acting career was over.
sentences.chinese: 他意识到自己的演艺事业已走到了尽头。

sentences.english: a physiotherapist who wanted to make a dramatic career change by becoming an author
sentences.chinese: 想彻底改行当作家的理疗师

sentences.english: Nurses want an improved career structure (= better opportunities to move upwards in their jobs ) .
sentences.chinese: 护士希望有更好的职业架构。

detailed_translations.english: the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes

sentences.english: Your goal as a parent is to help your child become an independent adult.
sentences.chinese: 身为父母，你的目标就是要培养孩子成为独立的成年人。

sentences.english: be in goal/keep goal (=be the goalkeeper)
sentences.chinese: 守球门

sentences.english: I scored the first goal.
sentences.chinese: 我踢进了第一个球。

detailed_translations.english: something that you hope to achieve in the future

sentences.english: The set (x, y) has two members.
sentences.chinese: （x, y）这个集里有两个项。

detailed_translations.english: a group of numbers, shapes etc in mathematics
